observation: I see a page with 'Select your residence' at the top and a large country dropdown list. There are multiple language modal overlays open that seem to be blocking interaction. I can see language options like English, Français, Español, etc. on both left and right sides of the screen. There's a country dropdown that shows 'Select' as placeholder, and I can see many country options in the list including Indonesia which I selected before. I need to close these language modals first to proceed with the country selection.
reasoning: As an elderly user, these overlapping language modals are confusing and blocking my view of the country selection. I need to close these modal dialogs first before I can properly interact with the country dropdown. I can see close buttons for the language modals.
ux_issues: Multiple overlapping language modals are confusing and blocking the main interface
Small close button may be difficult for elderly users to accurately tap
Language selection modal appears unexpectedly without clear trigger

outcome.visual_observation: Language modal overlay was successfully closed. The page now shows the clean residence selection interface without the modal overlay and colored annotations from the previous screenshot. The main content (residence selection form with country/region dropdown and Next button) is now clearly visible and accessible.
